author: potuz
content: For the simulation of gas usage: just assuming different levels of  numbers of users and accounts, and showing the results in different scenarios, wouldn't this be already a lot of usable info? I think digressing on more subtle points just gets lost in second-order optimization. At least having actual numbers of the form: if we have n million users we expect this state growth under the current average, etc.. then, and only then, the discussion could move towards worst possible scenarios etc..

author: pipermerriam
content: Yes, it seems like you could do some level of analysis of the transactions included in times of different gas prices.  The "theory" would be that in times of lower gas prices we see a higher number of distinct users.... and in times of high prices...  something else maybe?
